title: OT134: Open Zed
summary:
Key ideas:
- The bi-weekly visible open thread is available for anything except hot-button political and social topics
- The adversarial collaboration contest has 26 signed up teams so far
- Comment moderation includes removing inappropriate comments and checking over them before further action
- Going too general in comments is discouraged and may result in being banned
- Two new sidebar ads: 21st Night and Sparrow

Key learnings:
- The open thread is a place to post about anything else
- The adversarial collaboration contest has generated more interest this year
- Comment moderation involves removing comments and checking them over
- General comments may lead to banning
- Two new sidebar ads available

Key questions:
- What made the second post more successful than the first for the adversarial collaboration contest?
- Why is going too general discouraged in comments?
- What prompted the need for more comment moderation and how is it being handled?
- What other discussion topics are suggested for the bi-weekly visible open thread?
- What are the details about the two new sidebar ads?
